snippet: Republicans want to kill the board charged with controlling Medicare spending, but the board is a needed buffer between Congress and health care lobbies.
abstract: Editorial criticizes House Republicans for trying to kill off an independent board that is supposed to help rein in federal spending on Medicare, as part of their broader campaign to repeal health care reform; argues board is a needed buffer between Congress and the powerful health care lobbies that drive up spending.
lead_paragraph: Republicans want to kill the board charged with controlling Medicare spending, but the board is a needed buffer between Congress and health care lobbies.

headline.seo: Weren’t House Republicans Worried About Medicare Costs?
headline.main: We Thought They Were Worried About Costs
headline.print_headline: We Thought They Were Worried About Costs

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
